intro: Asclepias longicornu, commonly known as the longhorn milkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in wetland and swampy habitats. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Asclepias longicornu serves as a critical host plant for the monarch butterfly, supporting the life cycle of this iconic species.
